cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles WNW of Nassau and 180 miles SE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the north-western Bahamas, then turning north-northwest and skirting the Florida east coast toward Georgia and South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along or very near the east-central Florida coast (Cape Canaveral-Jacksonville corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Golden Beach FL to Edisto Beach SC, including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast, Georgia coast and South Carolina coast up to South Santee River
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) are likely Friday with a 73 % chance; hurricane-force gusts possible (34 % chance of sustained 50 kt, 14 % chance of 64 kt).
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC guidance indicates 6–9 ft of inundation possible from Sebastian Inlet to Edisto Beach, including portions of the St. Johns River that run through Jacksonville.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals up to 12 inches possible along the northeast Florida coast and the lower St. Johns River basin.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, possible river flooding along the St. Johns River, and potential debris impacts from strong winds that could disrupt port operations.
